text: in Afghanistan tradition carries on this
is a man's world where men work the
fields sit on local councils and almost
always have final say while women are
often relegated to the home but here in
Bamiyan a relatively peaceful province
in central Afghanistan traditional
gender roles are being uprooted thanks
in part to this woman namita joyous
called momentum ambulance I think this
is the only place for women who are
victims to come and raise their voice
and ask for their rights despite several
threats nahida rose I became bomb Ian's
first female police officer nearly five
years ago today she runs the police
department's domestic violence unit and
she has since recruited other women to
join the ranks now it's from one police
woman we have 15 habiba sarabi is bomb
Ian's governor the first and only female
governor in Afghanistan chief of being a
female leader can be risky business the
nation's most high profile female police
officer was murdered by the Taliban in
late-september mr. Robie has confronted
her own threats from jihadi leaders
these people not only because they are
against women they don't want to lose
their power always wanted to make
trouble for day and local governor to
save their own position their own rule
with a fearless governor and
considerable security Bamiyan his
fertile ground for female empowerment if
Afghanistan can one day be secured
Bamiyan may offer a model for the rest
of the country more than eighty percent
of Afghan women are illiterate girls
complete primary school at nearly
one-third the rate of boys and thirty
years of war has resulted in destitute
poverty gen
erations of war widows and domestic
abuse bamiyan is trying to change that
nokia bamyan province has the lowest
rate of violence and I think that's a
big achievement the family response unit
is like a protective wall for suffering
women and men along Afghanistan's roads
the driver's seat has long been reserved
for men in some regions women cannot
leave the house without a male relative
but in Bamiyan nineteen-year-old Zeinab
hussaini became the first female driver
most of the time my father is not at
home and the car is here if somebody
gets sick or there is something
important to do I take the car and do it
myself without needing anyone else if I
were not able to drive I don't know what
I would do following ms who say annie's
lead several other women here have taken
the wheel when people first saw me
driving they were shocked but now it's
become normal
